item.title: Double mattress fly tipped, 13th November
item.description:
Mattress has been dumped on the grass area.

item.title: Street lighting, 13th November
item.description:
As mentioned in earlier posts with regards to street lighting in the area, we have no lighting at all in paulinus close, causing it to be very dangerous when walking on both the pavements and road, investigation needed please

item.title: Acorns and tree debris on the path very dangerous, 13th November
item.description:

item.title: Leaves, 13th November
item.description:
We were pleased to see the leaf clearing vehicle this morning but unfortunately he was unable to clear the leaves along some of the road due to commuter parking.lease could he return at the weekend when parking is less of an issue. Thank you

item.title: Leaves blocking drains and public footpath, 13th November
item.description:
Leaves blocking public footpath and are also blocking drains. In addition, amount of leaves in the road has become a hazard for vehicles using the road. Location directly opposite the entrance to Chislehurst Rehabilitation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selby Close, Elmstead, London

item.title: Road work signs left behind, 13th November
item.description:

item.title: Could you please provide me with a reference number for this report so I can follow up if needed?, 13th November
item.description:
I would like to formally report an incident of graffiti and anti-social behaviour that took place on 26 October at around 10:00 AM on Thorne Path, directly outside my property. Several children were drawing graffiti on the brick wall and on the pavement areas (photos attached). The markings are still visible, and the general appearance of the area has noticeably deteriorated as a result. This behaviour makes me feel unsafe in my own neighbourhood, especially as this footpath is used daily by residents, including families and children. Seeing young people repeatedly gathering here and behaving in this way is concerning, and I am worried this may escalate if not addressed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Thorne Path, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling, 13th November
item.description:
There are many people round here with dogs they take them onto this green in the mornings and also in the evenings the smell and also not nice seeing them do this and not pick it up. On a walk out with family you can’t stop young kids running across the grass
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trenholme Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several wardrobe parts left by 1 Pennethorne Road, 13th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Pennethorne Road, Peckham, London

item.title: Outside Manor Lodge and all around Vale of Health, 13th November
item.description:
The pavements and roads are becoming so slippery due to the amount of leave fall. Can some one send a team done here to sort the problem out? The road sweeper only comes once in a while and only makes piles. Not good enough.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Vale of Health, West Hampstead, London
